overview:
José Capó is a Senior Software Engineer living in San Francisco with a diverse background. He was raised in Puerto Rico and then moved to Cambridge, MA to attend MIT at the age of 15.

After graduating with a degree in Mathematics, he spent his early career developing large-scale voicemail software and other telecommunications solutions. Before leaving Boston, he co-founded Common Voices, which specializes in migration of voice data from legacy platforms.

Since moving to San Francisco in 2008, he has focused on improving design practices in Agile development teams. He enjoys web development with tools such as Ruby on Rails and the latest advances in responsive front-end interfaces.
